title: Art & Craft
intro_description:
India is a land where art is not just a profession but a way of life. From the intricate weaves of the North to the vibrant metal crafts of the South, every region boasts a unique heritage passed down through generations. 

Explorers can dive into four distinct realms: **Pottery & Ceramics**, where earth is molded into utility and art; **Art & Paintings**, which tell epic tales on canvas and cloth; **Textiles & Weaving**, showcasing the world's finest silks and cottons; and **Handicrafts & Folk Crafts**, a diverse collection of wood, metal, and stone work. 

Witnessing these artisans at work is a journey into the soul of India, revealing stories of mythology, nature, and daily life etched into every creation.

cards.title: Blue Pottery
cards.short_description: A unique pottery style from Jaipur that uses quartz powder instead of clay, famous for its vibrant blue and floral patterns.

cards.title: Khavda Pottery
cards.short_description: Distinctive red clay pottery from Kutch, Gujarat, painted with black and white geometric patterns using natural colors.

cards.title: Nizamabad Black Pottery
cards.short_description: Glossy black pottery from Uttar Pradesh, known for its silver floral designs engraved into the fired clay.

cards.title: Bishnupur Terracotta
cards.short_description: Famous for the intricate terracotta temples and the 'Bankura Horse', a symbol of Bengali folk art.

cards.title: Raghurajpur Terracotta
cards.short_description: Delicate clay toys and masks created by the artisans of the heritage village Raghurajpur.

cards.title: Khurja Ceramics
cards.short_description: Colorful, glazed dinnerware and decorative items from Khurja, a historic pottery hub in Uttar Pradesh.

cards.title: Madhubani Painting
cards.short_description: Intricate geometrical patterns and mythological themes painted with natural dyes/pigments, originating from Bihar.

cards.title: Warli Painting
cards.short_description: A tribal art form from Maharashtra using simple white circles, triangles, and squares to depict daily life.

cards.title: Pattachitra
cards.short_description: Traditional scroll painting from Odisha known for its intricate details and mythological narratives of Lord Jagannath.

cards.title: Kalamkari Art
cards.short_description: Hand-painted or block-printed cotton textile art from Andhra Pradesh, produced using natural dyes and a 'kalam' (pen).

cards.title: Thangka Painting
cards.short_description: Tibetan Buddhist painting on cotton or silk appliqué, usually depicting a Buddhist deity, scene, or mandala.

cards.title: Rajput Miniature
cards.short_description: Exquisite, detailed paintings from the royal courts of Rajasthan, often depicting hunting scenes and royal life.

cards.title: Pahari Miniature
cards.short_description: A style of miniature painting from the Himalayan hill kingdoms, known for its lyrical nature and focus on love and devotion.

cards.title: Gond Painting
cards.short_description: Tribal art from Madhya Pradesh characterized by vibrant colors and a pattern of dots and dashes filling the forms.

cards.title: Kalighat Painting
cards.short_description: A 19th-century school of art from Kolkata, featuring bold outlines and vibrant colors depicting mythological and social themes.

cards.title: Banarasi Silk
cards.short_description: Luxurious silk saris from Varanasi, famous for their gold and silver brocade or zari, fine silk, and opulent embroidery.

cards.title: Chikankari
cards.short_description: Delicate and shadow work type of embroidery from Lucknow, traditionally performed on white muslin.

cards.title: Paithani Silk
cards.short_description: A variety of sari characterized by borders of an oblique square design, and a pallu with a peacock motif.

cards.title: Kanchipuram Silk
cards.short_description: Woven from pure mulberry silk, these saris from Tamil Nadu are distinguished by their wide contrasting borders.

cards.title: Pochampally Ikat
cards.short_description: A silk/cotton saree from Telangana known for its geometric patterns and the intricate Ikat dyeing style.

cards.title: Kalamkari Textile
cards.short_description: Distinct from the painting style, this involves rigorous block-printing on fabric using natural dyes in Machilipatnam.

cards.title: Sambalpuri Ikat
cards.short_description: Hand-woven ikats from Odisha where the warp and weft are tie-dyed before weaving. Includes Bomkai patterns.

cards.title: Jamdani Weaving
cards.short_description: A fine muslin textile with decorative motifs woven on the loom, typical of Bengal.

cards.title: Kantha Embroidery
cards.short_description: A form of embroidery from Bengal often used to stitch together old saris to make quilts (Nakshi Kantha).

cards.title: Puan Textiles
cards.short_description: The traditional skirt worn by Mizo women, woven on a loin loom with vibrant colors and bold stripes.

cards.title: Pashmina Shawl
cards.short_description: Fine cashmere wool textiles first woven in Kashmir, known for their softness and warmth.

cards.title: Bandhani
cards.short_description: A type of tie-dye textile decorated by plucking the cloth with the fingernails into many tiny bindings.

cards.title: Kathputli
cards.short_description: String puppets made of wood and cloth, central to Rajasthani folk theatre and storytelling.

cards.title: Bamboo & Cane Crafts
cards.short_description: Sustainable crafts from Northeast India, creating everything from baskets and furniture to intricate jewelry.

cards.title: Bidriware
cards.short_description: A metal handicraft from Bidar, Karnataka, featuring inlaid silver work on a blackened zinc and copper alloy.

cards.title: Dhokra Art
cards.short_description: Non-ferrous metal casting using the lost-wax casting technique, practiced by tribes in Bengal, Odisha, and Chattisgarh.

cards.title: Silver Filigree
cards.short_description: Highly skilled art form of super-fine silver wire work, used to create jewelry and decorative items.

cards.title: Sholapith
cards.short_description: A dried milky-white spongy plant matter from Bengal used to create intricate decorative art and headgears.

cards.title: Aranmula Kannadi
cards.short_description: A unique handmade metal-alloy mirror from Kerala, where the reflection comes from the front surface.

cards.title: Channapatna Toys
cards.short_description: Safe, vegetable-dyed wooden toys from Karnataka, traditionally made from ivory wood.

cards.title: Mysore Rosewood Inlay
cards.short_description: Intricate inlay work using different colored woods (and formerly ivory) set into rosewood surfaces.

cards.title: Sandalwood Carving
cards.short_description: Exquisite carving on fragrant sandalwood, producing figurines and caskets, mainly in Karnataka.

cards.title: Kondapalli Toys
cards.short_description: Brightly colored lightweight wooden toys from Andhra Pradesh, depicting scenes of rural life.

cards.title: Kutchi Woodwork
cards.short_description: Intricate wood carving from the Kutch region, often featuring geometric patterns and mirror work.

cards.title: Walnut Wood Carving
cards.short_description: Carving done on walnut wood, which is native to Kashmir, known for its durability and rich color.

cards.title: Saharanpur Carving
cards.short_description: Detailed wood carving and lattice work (Jali) from Uttar Pradesh, typically on Sheesham wood.

seo_title: Indian Art & Craft Guide: Pottery, Paintings, Textiles & Folk Art
seo_description: Explore the diverse world of Indian Art & Craft. From Blue Pottery and Madhubani Painting to Banarasi Silk and Dhokra metal casting.
